intro: Leonia triandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically has thick, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
